brief_summary.textblock:
The investigators are going to test if it is possible to detect early dementia with the
      digital game "memory". The investigators are going to test 15 healthy people and 15 patients
      with early dementia.

      The test consists of playing the game "memory" several times. While playing, several
      parameters are stored.

      The investigators are going to test if any correlation can be found between these parameters
      and the cognitive state of the person as tested by the Mini-Mental status examination.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Detection of Early Dementia With the Digital Game Memory

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  healthy 75-plusser

          -  75-plusser with early dementia

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  younger than 75

          -  patient with other cognitive impairments than dementia

study_pop.textblock:
-  healthy subjects of 75 or older

          -  subjects with mild dementia of 75 or older

primary_outcome.description: Failure is defined as the number of trials for the memory task
primary_outcome.measure: Association of cognitive status with failures in a computerised memory game
primary_outcome.time_frame: The game will be played once during 10-30 minutes.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case Control, Time Perspective: Cross-Sectional
